Choose your Operating System. Which operating system is your computer running?
Initial Setup (On Your Phone)
All Done That\'s all! If everything went well, the permission(s) should now be granted.
Open the Settings app and scroll down to About Phone. Tap it. Depending on your device, you may see a menu called \"Software Information\". If so, tap it. Now, find the option labeled \"Build Number\". On some devices, this may simply be called \"Version\". Tap that option 7 times to enable Developer Mode. You may need to enter your passcode to enable it. Now, go back to the main Settings page. Depending on your device, you may see a new menu called \"Developer Options\". If so, tap it and skip the next step. If you don\'t see the Developer Options menu, find the menu labeled either \"System\" or \"Additional Settings\". You should see the Developer Options menu inside that. Scroll down until you find the switch labeled \"USB Debugging\" and enable it. On Xiaomi phones, you\'ll also need to find and disable the option labeled \"USB Debugging (Security Settings)\". On OPPO, Realme, and OnePlus phones, you\'ll also need to find and enable the option labeled \"Disable Permission Monitoring\". Now, plug your phone into your computer. If a confirmation popup about USB Debugging appears, allow it. Once that\'s done, it\'s time to continue on your computer.
